meanings.definition: A strip of leather or other material used for fastening or securing something.
meanings.sent1: She used a strap to hold her backpack.
meanings.sent2: The watch had a leather strap.
meanings.sent3: He pretended the strap was a snake, slithering around his wrist.
meanings.sent4: The strap of the belt hugged his waist tightly.
meanings.sent5: The strap snapped, sending the bag flying.

meanings.definition: To fasten or secure with a strap.
meanings.sent1: He will strap the box shut before moving it.
meanings.sent2: She likes to strap her helmet on tight before riding.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to strap the apron on his head like a hat.
meanings.sent4: She will strap her emotions down tightly, not letting them show.
meanings.sent5: He will strap the seatbelt across his chest for safety.

meanings.definition: To beat or flog with a strap.
meanings.sent1: The teacher would strap the ruler against his palm.
meanings.sent2: He would strap the horse to make it run faster.
meanings.sent3: The pirate captain threatened to strap the crew if they didn't obey.
meanings.sent4: She felt like life was strapping her with challenges at every turn.
meanings.sent5: The wind seemed to strap the sails, pushing the ship forward.
